clinical_study.brief_title: Brief Intervention for Substance Use and Partner Abuse Among Females in the ER
clinical_study.official_title: A Computer-based Intervention for Women With Substance Use and Intimate Partner Violence in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to target co-occurring problems of substance use and intimate partner violence (IPV) using a computer-based intervention, B-SAFER (Brief intervention for Substance use and partner Abuse for Females in the Emergency Room). This project will develop and test the computer-based intervention, examining primary outcomes of substance use and utilization of relationship safety resources.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in past-month drug use days
primary_outcome.description: Drug use based on Timeline Followback.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in use of relationship safety behaviors and referral resources for IPV.
primary_outcome.description: Based on Safety Behavior Checklist and Effectiveness in Obtaining Resources scales.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in readiness to change drug use.
secondary_outcome.description: Based on readiness to change rulers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in readiness to change scale for relationship safety behaviors.
secondary_outcome.description: Based on readiness to change rulers.

arm_group.description: Patients randomized to the computer intervention will complete the B-SAFER computer program during their emergency department visit.
Patients randomized to the control arm will receive a time-equivalent computer-based program unrelated to substance use or partner violence.

intervention.description: Patients randomized to the computer intervention will complete the B-SAFER computer program during their emergency department visit.
Patients randomized to the control arm will receive a time-equivalent computer-based program unrelated to substance use or partner violence.

- intoxicated
- medically unstable as determined by ED staff

- psychosis
- combative
- in police custody
